author: Fargol Araghi
text: 'I had a bad experience at this place! I am not sure about the level of cleanness!'

author: Ryan Kelly
text: 'A bit pricey but the rolls are quite good. A go to place for good sushi in hoboken'

author: Timothy Auyeung
text: 'Everything is good
column5: just never told me about a 3 dollar delivery fee.....'

author: Nil Cor
text: 'Love this place. Have been attending for years now.'

author: Erin Rodriguez
text: 'Illuzion left a sour taste in my mouth. I was really excited to try their sushi as it was one of the few sushi restaurants in Hoboken that I haven‚Äôt tried yet. Last week
column5: I went to go pickup my takeout order & when I got there
column6:
I was asked if I picked up the order 10 minutes ago. Turns out they gave my order to someone else. I had to wait an additional 25 minutes to get my order remade on top of the 30 minutes I had already waited.

Tip for the restaurant: ask for the customer‚Äôs names when you‚Äôre taking an order on the phone. Mistakes can happen when you only take the customer‚Äôs phone number.

The sushi itself was below average. The Philadelphia rolls had so much cream cheese that it reminded me of bagels from Dunkin that are notoriously always loaded with pounds of cream cheese. The rolls weren‚Äôt fresh
column9: and I didn‚Äôt enjoy a single bite.'

author: Alaa ElShazly
text: 'The waiter was very rude any requests was declined
column5: i wont recommend the place for anyone'

author: Coupling Gamers
text: 'It was amazing great service and food'

author: Hoda Tantawi
text: 'I wanted my sushi without rice. Yes its a weird request but I get it everywhere we go.Some times I get charged extra and I dont mind. When I asked and she said no
column5: I told her you can charge me more she said no very rudely. I asked if she can ask if its possible she said no'

author: Allan Xiao
text: "Service was good
column5: I ordered salmon tataki but somehow they heard it as teriyaki. They refunded that so will give them a star for that.\n\nBut food overall was meh
column6: especially for the price. Bought 2 lunch specials: 3 rolls
column7: udon tempura. Sushi didn't taste like fish
column8: more like sweet potatoes. Udon Tempura
column9: shrimp was small and the tempura in general was more like biting a hard cookie and very dry. Half the udon was just greens. Didn't eat much of itÔºåjust drank the soup.\n\nSalad was just lettuce."

author: IEmersonTellEmI
text: 'Great food and staff is really nice!'

author: Luis Velez
text: 'Had the spider ramen which was delicious and filling. Had zero wait time but got busy real quick. Service was good.'

author: Megan Gillen
text: 'This spot has good sushi as well as ramen. Both times I‚Äôve gone I‚Äôve had good service and didn‚Äôt have to wait long for a table. Food was tasty - I‚Äôll definitely be back!'

author: amber white
text: 'Friendly staff
column5: great fresh food'

author: David Rosensaft
text: 'Interesting food. Very fast service'

author: Marc Cohen
text: 'The service was absolutely terrible. They truly don‚Äôt care about their customers and the food is extremely subpar. Would highly recommend avoiding.'

author: Neil Shah
text: 'Used to love this place
column5: and it was my go to sushi in Hoboken for 11 years. But the food I had today was awful. Lobster we straight rubber. Tuna made me gag. Salmon was okay. And the shrimp was slimy. I should have known better based on how quickly my meal was ready
column6: but nothing seemed fresh. Hopefully this was an anomaly.'

author: Hazzel Bx
text: "I ordered here last night and just wow. I ordered tuna tataki
column5: sushi deluxe
column6: yellowtail jalapeno rolls and chicken teriyaki for the family. This was by far the best Japanese food I've had in a long time. Everything tasted so fresh. We were so happy with the quality of the food we will most certainly be ordering from here again."

author: Cesca Cat
text: 'Love it here

author: Alejandra ‚ÄúAle‚Äù Santana
text: 'Simple
column5: neat and simple. Very comfortable and delicious ramen soup and green tea tempura ice cream. I would like to visit again!!'

author: Anaury Garcia
text: 'Loved the place. Food was excellent. When I visited was just opening so there was not a lot of people.\n\nYou can bring your own bottle!'

author: Wendy T
text: "So delicious and clean tasting. I luv this place! I always get the fried rice or udon with vegetables in a stir fry teriyaki sauce and it is absolutely AMAZEBALLS!!! Things to note: call ahead
column5: pay ahead
column6: and parking is tough. It's best to arrive on 4th St. and request curbside
column7: if they're not too busy to accommodate. Very nice staff

author: Resourceman1
text: 'I am so sorry to have to post this poor review. I had such a nice meal all went well. Then I get home today and check my credit card and they added $10 tip to my credit card when I left $11 cash tip. I do this so they get their money right away and this is how they repay me for thinking of them. This is either the greedy owner or host I have no idea
column5: but be aware they have no problem adding to your card. I am 100% sure the bill is $52 I have the receipt . They charged my card $62. what a shame because I liked it there now I will never go back. shame on you !!!!!'

text: 'Great sushi place. Fresh and delicious. Highly recommended!'

author: Vincent Maupu
text: 'This place is absolutely not transparent ont their pricing. I placed on order based on the menu provided on THEIR website and found out when they deliver the food that the prices had actually been increased by more than 40%!!!\nFor instance
column5: their Maguro sushi is advertised at $3.5 per piece on their website while the actual price is $5!!!! When I called to complain about this huge gap in prices
column6: absolutely NO EFFORT NOR PRICE ADJUSTMENT were provided.\nThe official website is actually pure PRICE MISLEAdING and FALSE ADVERTISING. I just don‚Äôt want anyone to fall I the same trap and will make sure to follow with official institution to see if any legal action can be intended against these thieves!'

text: 'After trying 3-4 other local sushi spots I think Illuzion takes the cake for takeout! Definitely our go to for salmon avocado rolls

text: "I had classic Sutton Illuzion

I don't think the toppings are particularly impressive. Andrew gave a ok rating to tan tan Illuzion. We also tried the unagi rice ball

text: 'It seems they warm up the food in a microwave. The food was only warm on the top and the rest was cold. The soup was not hot. It happened twice (I will not try the third) They don‚Äôt take complaints or suggestions pleasantly. I have been there many times in the last few years

text: "This is a great option for sushi and other Asian dishes. The service was excellent and I heard it's also a great delivery option although I have not ordered delivery or take out from them yet. My wife forgot her sunglasses there and they kept them for 2 weeks until we came back and picked them up. Illuzion is now on my list of favorites in Hoboken."

author: Georgiana Bobe
text: 'Food is good. Service a little slow and place was not crowded.  They did accommodate all our requests.'

author: Melanie Tam
text: "There are not a lot of sushi options in Hoboken but this one was probably the worst one I've been too. We came in at around 9 pm on a Saturday night and the place was empty. And I know you're thinking it's probably because it's past prime dinner hours
column5: but when we walked past its competitors around the same time (and even after)
column6: business was booming for them.\n\nI ordered the yellowtail scallion
column8: and salmon rolls. The fish felt like it was lukewarm. I don't think it went bad or anything like that
column9: it just tasted like they defrosted the fish and left it out for too long. My BF ordered the spicy salmon
column11: and spicy yellowtail roll. I've been telling him for years how much I dislike those rolls because all you taste is the spicy mayo
column12: and everything ends up tasting the same. He always disagreed with me until we dined at Illuzion. He said he finally realized what I was talking about.\n\nWe also ordered some fried rice
column13: which was surprisingly pretty good. It had a lot of black (or white?) pepper in it
column14: which is why we liked it. So if you don't like peppery things
column15: you should probably avoid this one. Or just try to avoid Illuzion in general."

author: Maureen Noto
text: 'Best sushi and sashimi in town'

column5: a sushi isn't cheap but is always great quality. Awesome variety of special rolls to keep everyone happy."

text: "Got food poisoning from the horrible sushi they serve.   It's unlike any sushi I have ever seen/had.  Complete garbage.\nThe desserts are very good

text: "Probably the tastiest sushi I've ever had
column5: and I travel way too much and eat way too much sushi.   But there was just something a bit different about their sushi.  The flavors were so damn good.   Note: it's BYOB so make a run across the street before sitting here.  But you will never regret coming to this place."

author: Erin Carrather
text: 'Trustworthy spot with outdoor seating (bring your dogs!).'

author: Wei Xin Yuan
text:
'3.5

Sushi look okay but I am not tempted to try.

I usually get Ramen. The shrimp (seafood) ramen seems to have the most ingredients. The softshell crab ramen is most pricey but I felt it didn't have much ingredients. The char siu (bbq pork) ramen was okay
column5:
but pales vs the shrimp one. Not really tempted to try the other ramens here.

For ramen this place beats vivi (bubble tea place) or so gong dong fresh (on hudson street; "korean" place that serve horribly bland "ramen").

Note this place does not serve alcohol
column6: which makes it less fun for work outings.'

author: Gregory Taylor
text: 'Love the Salmon Bento Box!'

author: Lul√∫ Acevedo
text: "This restaurant was a bad experience. Last Saturday July 22
column5: my sister
column6: my husband and I went out for a snack
column7: an ice cream and a refreshment of some sort. Big empty space with umbrellas and unoccupied seats prompted us to choose this place among so many others along the beautiful and popular Washington street of the city of Hoboken. We were served; and a few moments after enjoying our deserts and drinks  - NOT QUITE FINISHED YET -     the waitress brought us the bill. Right away this may very well be understood that if we weren't going to order anything else it was time for us to pay and go. We were under the impression that we were not being welcomed since even the use of the ladies room seems to have upset them! At the end of our short visit we  decided not to tip them. And a little while after leaving
column8: next thing we know is the waitress running after us; she was claiming we didn't leave any tip to which we responded that we didn't feel they deserve any! We asked: Was this tip under some sort of new City mandate? She couldn't answer; and for decency and to avoid any confrontation
column9: we preferred to actually give her a minimum tip. This restaurant has a very bad attitude
column11: it is not a place to go back or even visit anymore.!"

text: 'Took two hours for food to be delivered via grubhub. Called and was told my order would arrive within a few minutes but still took an additional twenty minutes to arrive. Portions were small and sushi was on par with what you may pickup at a supermarket.  My first experience and most likely my last.'

text: 'Awful experience from the good to the service. Huge mistake.'

text: 'Found a STAPLE in my food!! Called them and they did absolutely nothing about it. Do not eat here!'

text: "once a week here ....of course food is always good
column5: and the service uh....\nbut i understand it's hard of them
column6: because the culture is different ....the point is food!!!"

author: Jonathan Arrabito
text: "I love this place.  This is my favorite sushi joint in Hoboken.  The service is great
column5: the fish is fresh and the portions are decently sized.  As far as hoboken sushi goes
column6: this one is top notch.  I have tried others in town and none are up to par with Illuzion.  I highly recommend the California Sea Urchin.  Just don't eat it all. Make sure you leave some for me. :)"

author: Victor Nikulin
text: 'always fresh and tasty
column5: very friendly staff !'

author: Julian
text: 'THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!!! I had some sort of Shrimp Bento from the Lunch Specials. I dont remember the name from the top of my head but it was phenominal. Service was on top of everything with taking our finished plates and even the wrappers from the straws and chopsticks! They are so kind too! I gave my server a good tip and they gave me a free dessert! It was so kind they really didnt need to it was my pleasure for tipping for fine food
column5: dining
column6: and service!'

author: Luke Hansen
text: 'I was torn between giving Illuzion 3 or 4 stars.  3 stars feels a bit harsh and I decided the avocado/mango roll was unique enough to warrant 4 stars.  Illuzion is a solid sushi restaurant.  I went there for lunch and had the lunch special of 3 rolls for $13.  I went with the asparagus
column5: sweet potato
column6: and the aforementioned avocado/mango rolls.  The lunch special included a small salad and miso soup.  Both were what you would expect.  The rolls were good.  As mentioned
column7: the real standout was the avocado/mango.  I have never had mango in a roll.  It was very refreshing.  I would go back just for those.  The service was friendly and attentive.  My one critique is the appearance of the sushi bar.  I would recommend sprucing that space up a bit.  There was duct tape on the metal "cabinet" that houses the raw fish.  It looked worn and needs to be fixed to be more appealing to those patrons sitting at the bar.'

author: Joe McDonald
text: "Terrible. The skin was still on the fish. They didn't even use sushi rice
column5: so it fell apart in my hand. Gross."

author: Jeremy Gollehon
text: "Ordered sashimi
column5: sushi
column6: and chicken teriyaki for delivery. Food arrived in 20 minutes and was literally the worst I've had. Dry rice
column8: blah fish. I'll give them another shot in the restaurant to see if they actually deliver fresh food to the table. They obviously sent us leftovers from lunch for dinner delivery.  Why 2 stars? The miso soup was excellent. :-)"

author: Shep Di Cesare
text: "Best sushi in Hoboken
column5: hands down.   We've been ordering and going for years.  Their special chef rolls are the best."

author: Richard Huften
text: 'my girlfriend and I eat here at least once a week. Sushi is fresh and the service is incredible!! We love Illuzion!! Best sushi in Hoboken!'

author: Gerardo Silva
text: 'The sea food is great is light sauce and the portions are nice and light'

author: Ama Geewandara
text: 'Sushi and sashimi was (fresh and well prepared) great. The miso soup and salad came with it was not as great as sushi or sashimi. Good sized portions and reasonably priced. Nothing to complain or praise about the service. It was a generally OK service. I would go there again.'

author: Michael Paulauski
text: "Absolutely amazing sushi
column5: and at an amazing price: the Maki Lunch Special is possibly the best deal for sushi you'll get in Hoboken."

author: Joe J.
text: "Beef tataki was awesome. Actually the appetizers in general were awesome. The entrees were pretty standard. I didn't get to try any rolls. I like that they provide brown rice. Yay for health"

author: Sei Lee
text: "Rude service and  mediocre sushi. Why take reservation if you were going to give out tables to others? Walk in customers served prior to people who reserved. Food was just mediocre. Can't believe this place get rave reviews. Fake Chinese sushi place owned by Chinese and they drive u out when u r not even done with the food and giving out the check. Not coming back."

author: Satyanarayana Reddy Gadekal (Satya)
text: 'Sushi

text: 'BYOB and the sushi is great! Only issue is that when they are busy they can rush you out of your table.'
